meanings.definition: In a manner that is excessively correct or precise.
meanings.sent1: She hypercorrectly adjusted the picture frame until it was perfectly straight.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks hypercorrectly during important presentations.
meanings.sent3: The robot hypercorrectly followed the instructions to the letter, even though it wasn't necessary.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so hypercorrect that she could spot a tiny error from a mile away.
meanings.sent5: The architect hypercorrectly measured every angle to ensure the building was structurally sound.

meanings.definition: To correct something in an overly meticulous or pedantic way.
meanings.sent1: She tends to hypercorrectly proofread her essays multiple times before submitting them.
meanings.sent2: He would hypercorrectly rearrange the items on his desk until they were in perfect order.
meanings.sent3: The teacher hypercorrectly marked every single punctuation mistake in the student's paper.
meanings.sent4: The chef hypercorrectly adjusted the seasoning in the dish to achieve the perfect balance of flavors.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic hypercorrectly fine-tuned the engine to ensure optimal performance.
